docs.snippet: While the hope was to blot out the bad memory of the last time the country hosted the World Cup, the outcome was if anything worse. But in a more mature Brazil, people are asking whether it will matter as much....
docs.lead_paragraph: While the hope was to blot out the bad memory of the last time the country hosted the World Cup, the outcome was if anything worse. But in a more mature Brazil, people are asking whether it will matter as much.
docs.abstract: Germany's World Cup rout of Brazil is vivid reminder of how the fortunes of host country's national soccer team can mirror how Brazilians view their society even as other traumas recede into history; humiliating loss stings for many Brazilians but others are trying to put loss in perspective and wonder how much it really matters.

headline.main: Brazilians Grumble and Take Stock After Crushing World Cup Loss
headline.print_headline: Brazilians Grumble and Take Stock After Crushing World Cup Loss

byline.contributor: Mariana Simões contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, Lucy Jordan from Brasília, and Seth Kugel from São Paulo, Brazil.

docs.snippet: Andre Johnson spent months away from the team and ultimately decided his future is not with the Houston Texans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andre Johnson spent months away from the team and ultimately decided his future is not with the Houston Texans.

docs.snippet: Brazil football great Zico says coach Luiz Felipe Scolari must be replaced if his country is to move past its disappointing World Cup performance....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil football great Zico says coach Luiz Felipe Scolari must be replaced if his country is to move past its disappointing World Cup performance.

headline.main: Zico Says Brazil Should Replace Scolari as Coach
headline.print_headline: Zico Says Brazil Should Replace Scolari as Coach

docs.snippet: Neymar became emotional when talking Thursday about the injury that ruled him out of the World Cup, saying that if the knee to his back had been slightly more to one side he "could be in a wheelchair" right now....
docs.lead_paragraph: Neymar became emotional when talking Thursday about the injury that ruled him out of the World Cup, saying that if the knee to his back had been slightly more to one side he "could be in a wheelchair" right now.

headline.main: Neymar Thankful He's Not in a Wheelchair Now
headline.print_headline: Neymar Thankful He's Not in a Wheelchair Now

docs.snippet: FIFA has rejected Luis Suarez's appeal against his lengthy ban for biting an opponent in a World Cup match....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has rejected Luis Suarez's appeal against his lengthy ban for biting an opponent in a World Cup match.

headline.main: FIFA Rejects Suarez Appeal Against Ban for Biting
headline.print_headline: FIFA Rejects Suarez Appeal Against Ban for Biting

docs.snippet: Brazil's humiliating 7-1 defeat by Germany has left a deep scar on the World Cup hosts and highlighted the need for a football shake-up in the country, but it was not on the same scale as the "national tragedy" of losing the 1950 final, Sports Min...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's humiliating 7-1 defeat by Germany has left a deep scar on the World Cup hosts and highlighted the need for a football shake-up in the country, but it was not on the same scale as the "national tragedy" of losing the 1950 final, Sports Minister Aldo Rebelo said on Thursday.

headline.main: Brazil Sports Minister Says 7-1 Loss Shows Shake-Up Needed
headline.print_headline: Brazil Sports Minister Says 7-1 Loss Shows Shake-Up Needed

docs.snippet: After their own World Cup hopes fell apart in the most humiliating way, Brazilians must now grapple with the prospect that things could get even worse....
docs.lead_paragraph: After their own World Cup hopes fell apart in the most humiliating way, Brazilians must now grapple with the prospect that things could get even worse.

headline.main: Brazil's Misery Worsens With Argentina in Final
headline.print_headline: Brazil's Misery Worsens With Argentina in Final

docs.snippet: FIFA has fined the Argentine Football Association 300,000 Swiss francs ($340,000) for failing to bring players to pre-match news conferences at the World Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has fined the Argentine Football Association 300,000 Swiss francs ($340,000) for failing to bring players to pre-match news conferences at the World Cup.

headline.main: FIFA Fines Argentina for Breaching World Cup Rules
headline.print_headline: FIFA Fines Argentina for Breaching World Cup Rules

docs.snippet: Uruguay forward Luis Suarez, banned from all football activity for four months and nine competitive internationals for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match, has lost his appeal, FIFA said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay forward Luis Suarez, banned from all football activity for four months and nine competitive internationals for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match, has lost his appeal, FIFA said on Thursday.

headline.main: Suarez Loses Appeal Against Biting Ban
headline.print_headline: Suarez Loses Appeal Against Biting Ban

docs.snippet: Once the World Cup and its traveling circus leaves town, four gleaming stadiums that cost $1.6 billion and hosted massive crowds will echo noisily as their owners struggle to find a use for them or even partially fill them....
docs.lead_paragraph: Once the World Cup and its traveling circus leaves town, four gleaming stadiums that cost $1.6 billion and hosted massive crowds will echo noisily as their owners struggle to find a use for them or even partially fill them.

headline.main: Brazil's New Stadiums Seek Post-World Cup Events
headline.print_headline: Brazil's New Stadiums Seek Post-World Cup Events
